title: Multimodal CoT Reasoning

definitions.Problem: The question is: Which solution has a higher concentration of yellow particles?
definitions.Context: The diagram below is a model of two solutions. Each yellow ball represents one particle of solute.
definitions.Options: (A) Solution B (B) Solution A (C) neither; their concentrations are the same
definitions.Gold Rationale: In Solution A and Solution B, the yellow particles represent the solute. To figure out which solution has a higher concentration of yellow particles, look at both the number of yellow particles and the volume of the solvent in each container. Use the concentration formula to find the number of yellow particles per milliliter. Solution B has more yellow particles per milliliter. So, Solution B has a higher concentration of yellow particles.
